metadata.synopsis: Uktar is a bursar for the Guild, Baldur's Gate's foremost organised crime outfit. He is humourless and self-important, nurturing a quiet grudge against Nine-Fingers and her blunt leadership style. Uktar asks the player to retrieve keys to Counting House vaults for him, and can provide a hint about where to find Minsc in return.He comments on the individual to whom each key we sell him belongs, which is the only time he shows true animation.

48.speaker: Uktar
48.text: Uktar - I remain Guild bursar, whoever sits in the big chair. Do we have business?

66.speaker: Uktar
66.text: Uktar, bursar. If we have business, speak - Guild time is too precious to waste.

70.speaker: Uktar
70.text: You are not known to me. For supplies, seek the bugbear. To trade trinkets, the Fetcher's Brats.

64.speaker: Uktar
64.text: I am Uktar, duly elected Guild bursar, and I will not have my time wasted.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: Is that what Nine-Fingers was doing, earlier? Wasting Guild time with this Stone Lord business?
29.context: NodeContext: Probing, but not too obviously - she's insightful enough to draw people out on the things that bother them

52.speaker: Player
52.text: Is that what Nine-Fingers was doing, earlier? Wasting Guild time with this Stone Lord business?
52.context: NodeContext: Probing, but not too obviously - she's insightful enough to draw people out on the things that bother them

71.speaker: Jaheira
71.text: Is that what Nine-Fingers was doing, earlier? Wasting Guild time with this Stone Lord business?
71.context: NodeContext: Probing, but not too obviously - she's insightful enough to draw people out on the things that bother them

32.speaker: Uktar
32.text: You might say so. I could not possibly comment.
32.context: NodeContext: He would very much say so if he could

42.speaker: Jaheira
42.text: I sense there is no love lost between the two of you.
42.context: NodeContext: Not an accusation, just an observation

76.speaker: Player
76.text: 'Uktar'. Ponder where you know the name from.
76.context: NodeContext: Eyebrow raised - he's not an idiot

89.speaker: Player
89.text: 'Uktar'. Ponder where you know the name from.
89.context: NodeContext: Eyebrow raised - he's not an idiot

18.speaker: Narrator
18.text: *Uktar, eleventh month of the year - more commonly known as 'the Rotting', the time in which all things decay and die.*

72.speaker: Narrator
72.text: *Uktar, eleventh month of the year - more commonly known as 'the Rotting', the time in which all things decay and die.*

53.text: *Familiar as it sounds, the reference eludes you.*

37.speaker: Narrator
37.text: *Familiar as it sounds, the reference eludes you.*

49.speaker: Player
49.text: The Stone Lord is disrupting Guild business. Maybe you can help me fix that.
49.context: NodeContext: Eyebrow raised - he's not an idiot

75.speaker: Uktar
75.text: By telling you where he is, in direct defiance of my guildmaster's orders?
75.context: NodeContext: Eyebrow raised - he's not an idiot

55.text: By telling you where he is, in direct defiance of my guildmaster's orders?
55.context: NodeContext: Eyebrow raised - he's not an idiot

27.speaker: Uktar
27.text: By telling you where he is, in direct defiance of my guildmaster's orders?
27.context: NodeContext: Eyebrow raised - he's not an idiot

25.speaker: Uktar
25.text: I have not come so far by being so foolish. The city has weathered crises before, and the Guild coffers along with it. Try someone else.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: You're no fan of Nine-Fingers. Tell me her plans for the Stone Lord.

95.speaker: Uktar
95.text: Whatever face you believe lies beneath this mask, I assure you it is not that of a gaping fool.

36.text: Whatever face you believe lies beneath this mask, I assure you it is not that of a gaping fool.

11.speaker: Uktar
11.text: Whatever face you believe lies beneath this mask, I assure you it is not that of a gaping fool.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: You're named after the Rotting. Something to do with the mask?
61.context: NodeContext: Gritted teeth - he does not like Nine-Fingers, but still works for her

44.speaker: Uktar
44.text: A... gift from Nine-Fingers. She has a penchant for literal names, and her cronies ensured it stuck.
44.context: NodeContext: Gritted teeth - he does not like Nine-Fingers, but still works for her

14.speaker: Player
14.text: I sense there's no love lost between you and the guildmaster.

26.speaker: Uktar
26.text: Do you. How interesting. Now do we have business, or no?

80.speaker: Uktar
80.text: I need not love to serve. You have a point you wish to make?

33.speaker: Player
33.text: The quicker I deal with the Stone Lord, the quicker Nine-Fingers gets back to business.
33.context: NodeContext: He doesn't care about personal insults, even though he dislikes NIneFingers. But he WILL help us if we help him

57.speaker: Uktar
57.text: I have not come so far by indulging in petty disputes. But... I am open to transactions of mutual benefit.
57.context: NodeContext: He doesn't care about personal insults, even though he dislikes NIneFingers. But he WILL help us if we help him

96.speaker: Uktar
96.text: I told you that I wish to acquire keys to the Counting House vaults. I suspect that what you seek might also be found down there.
96.context: NodeContext: Shrugging - he's given us the info we need, he's not going to do any more

10.speaker: Uktar
10.text: But who knows. You will have to take it upon yourself to go there and find out.
10.context: NodeContext: Shrugging - he's given us the info we need, he's not going to do any more

50.speaker: Player
50.text: She plans to ambush Minsc at the Counting House? But what the hells would he want there?

68.speaker: Jaheira
68.text: She plans to ambush Minsc at the Counting House? But what the hells would he want there?

9.speaker: Uktar
9.text: I am interested in gaining access to vaults beneath the Counting House. I pay well for keys to those vaults. Provided said vaults are not emptied prematurely, of course.
9.context: NodeContext: First and only moment of him taking us into his confidence. He wants something.

4.speaker: Uktar
4.text: I suspect that what you seek might also be found beneath the Counting House. I tell you this only as a matter of mutual interest.
4.context: NodeContext: Telling us where Minsc is while maintaing deniability that he ever said it

84.speaker: Uktar
84.text: What you do with that information is a matter for yourself. Now, back to vault keys - do we have business to conduct?
84.context: NodeContext: Telling us where Minsc is while maintaing deniability that he ever said it

17.speaker: Uktar
17.text: I clearly recall asking you not to waste my time.

78.speaker: Uktar
78.text: Then we are wasting one another's time.

79.speaker: Player
79.context: NodeContext: Deadpan, not rising to our bait. He wears a smiling silver mask that hides his face.

65.speaker: Uktar
65.text: Yes. That is why I am smiling.
65.context: NodeContext: Deadpan, not rising to our bait. He wears a smiling silver mask that hides his face.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: Do you always take yourself so seriously, Uktar?

86.speaker: Uktar
86.text: It is Guild business I take seriously, as you ought to. That business is finance.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: Bursar - is that a fancy word for thieves' accountant?
8.context: NodeContext: Telling us where Minsc is while maintaing deniability that he ever said it

22.speaker: Uktar
22.text: I do not hand out loans, if that is what you're asking. My business is finance.
22.context: NodeContext: Telling us where Minsc is while maintaing deniability that he ever said it

62.speaker: Uktar
62.text: Specifically - the acquisition of vault keys. The wealthy squirrel their riches away in the city's Counting House, where it gathers dust, serving no one.
62.context: NodeContext: First and only hint of contempt / true emotion slipping through

24.speaker: Uktar
24.text: I acquire keys and allow these funds to circulate, like lifeblood in a healthy body. Everyone benefits - particularly those who bring me such keys.
24.context: NodeContext: First and only hint of contempt / true emotion slipping through

7.speaker: Uktar
7.text: So. Are you wasting my time, or do you seek to benefit?

21.speaker: Uktar
21.text: The great wizard. I will be interested to see what manner of curiosities he deems worth locking away.

28.speaker: Player
28.context: NodeContext: Officious, knows we stole it

34.speaker: Uktar
34.text: A fine and noble house. Their funds will serve the city, as they would wish.
34.context: NodeContext: Officious, knows we stole it

97.speaker: Uktar
97.text: Ah. A rather ancient patron of the Counting House. He has accrued quite a bit of interest, I'd wager.

69.speaker: Uktar
69.text: Ah, the would-be Duke! I'm sure he parted with it on good terms.

0.speaker: Player
0.context: NodeContext: Not looking too far into where we got the key

54.speaker: Uktar
54.text: The returning hero of Elturel. He's the philanthropic sort, so I'll assume this was a gift, yes?
54.context: NodeContext: Not looking too far into where we got the key

45.speaker: Player
45.context: NodeContext: Dry, faux innocence. You've just sold him the property of his boss - but he great dislikes her, and happily buys it

60.speaker: Uktar
60.text: A most peculiar key to have in your possession. I wonder who it belongs to.
60.context: NodeContext: Dry, faux innocence. You've just sold him the property of his boss - but he great dislikes her, and happily buys it

43.speaker: Uktar
43.text: DeVir. Now what would a servant of Lady Loss be so keen on keeping safe?

74.speaker: Player
74.context: NodeContext: Smug satisfaction - Glitterbeard is a rival

91.speaker: Uktar
91.text: Glitterbeard. He was given mastery of the Counting House over me, you know. Well deserved, wouldn't you say?
91.context: NodeContext: Smug satisfaction - Glitterbeard is a rival

30.speaker: Player
30.text: I've given you everything I have.

81.speaker: Uktar
81.text: Then our business is done, for now.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: I have no keys to sell right now.

3.speaker: Player
3.context: NodeContext: Deadpan, uninterested in our curiousity about his mask

41.speaker: Uktar
41.context: NodeContext: Deadpan, uninterested in our curiousity about his mask

88.speaker: Uktar
88.text: Uktar, Guild bursar. Do we have business?
